title: What is a scale?
content: A scale is a sequence of musical notes arranged in ascending or descending order. The most common scale is the C Major Scale: C – D – E – F – G – A – B. Click the button below to hear the scale.

title: Major vs Minor Chords: Visual Guide
content: Let's understand the difference between major and minor chords visually. Below are diagrams showing the C major chord (C + E + G) and C minor chord (C + Eb + G). Notice how the middle note (the third) is what changes between major and minor.

title: Major vs Minor Chords: Practice
content: Now it's your turn! Try playing both the C major and C minor chords on the pianos below. Click the keys to select them, then press 'Play Chord' to hear how they sound together.

title: Build a G Chord
content: Try building a G chord! G Major = G + B + D. G Minor = G + Bb + D. Click to toggle between major/minor.
